data.title: E. M. S. Namboodiripad bibliography
data.text:
Elamkulam Manakkal Sankaran Namboodiripad (13 June 1909 – 19 March 1998), popularly known as EMS, was an Indian communist politician and theorist, who served as the first Chief Minister of Kerala state in 1957–59 and then again in 1967–69. As a member of the Communist Party of India (CPI), he became the first non-Indian National Congress chief minister in the Indian republic.[1] In 1964, he led a faction of the CPI that broke away to form the Communist Party of India (Marxist) (CPI(M)).[2]

This article contains lists of notable works of and on E. M. S. Namboodiripad.

Notable works in English

[edit]

Sl no. Title Year Publishers Remark(s) Reference(s) 1 A Short History of the Peasant Movement in Kerala 1943 Peoples Pub. House, Bombay [3] 2 National Question in Kerala 1952 Peoples Pub. House, Bombay [4] 3 Mahatma and His Ism 1958 Leftword Books [5] 4 Problems of National Integration 1966 National Book Agency, Calcutta [6] 5 What really happened in Kerala; the story of the disruptive game played by right-wing communists 1966 National Book Agency, Calcutta [7][8] 6 Economics and Politics of Indian Socialist Pattern 1966 Peoples Pub. House, New Delhi [9][10] 7 Kerala Yesterday, Today and Tomorrow 1967 National Book Agency, Calcutta [11] 8 India Under Congress Rule 1967 National Book Agency, Calcutta [12] 9 Conflicts and crisis : political India 1974 Orient Longman [13] 10 Indian Planning in Crisis 1974 Chintha Publishers [14] 11 How I Became a Communist 1976 Chintha Publishers [15] 12 Crisis into chaos: Political India 1981 1981 Sangam Books, Bombay First published by Orient Longman under the title 'Conflicts and crisis' in 1974. [16] 13 Selected Writings Vol. I 1982 National Book Agency, Calcutta [17] 14 Kerala Society and Politics: A Historical Survey 1984 National Book Centre, New Delhi [18] 15 Selected Writings Vol. II 1985 National Book Agency, Calcutta [19] 16 A History of Indian Freedom Struggle 1986 Social Scientist Press [20] 17 Reminiscence of an Indian Communist 1987 National Book Centre, New Delhi [21] 18 Nehru: Ideology and Practice 1988 National Book Centre, New Delhi [22] 19 Communist Party in Kerala: Six Decades of Struggle and Advance 1994 National Book Centre, New Delhi [23]
